sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "

Consider the figure given below. In this figure we have \(GH \parallel FK \), and \(GI \parallel FL \). Now, prove that \(HI \parallel KL \).
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
In the triangle JKF , we have $GH \parallel FK $. So, we can write that
\[
	\frac{H\input[s1v1]{} }{HK } = \frac{JG }{\input[s1v2]{}F }
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
Now, again in triangle JLF , we have $GI \parallel FL $. So, we can write
\[
	\frac{JG }{GF } = \frac{J\input[s2v1]{} }{\input[s2v2]{}L }
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
From the above two equations, we get
\[
	\frac{\input[s3v1]{}H }{HK } = \frac{\input[s3v2]{}I }{IL }
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
Thus, in the triangle JKL we can write 
\[
	\frac{JH }{\input[s4v1]{}\input[s4v2]{}} = \frac{JI }{IL }
\]
Which means $HI \parallel KL $. Hence proved.
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["J", "G"], "text": "$$\text{In the triangle JKF , we have $GH \parallel FK $, therefore, from the basic proportionality theorem $\frac{JH }{HK } = \frac{JG }{GF }$.}$$"}, {"data": ["I", "I"], "text": "$$\text{In the triangle JLF , we have $GI \parallel FL $, therefore, again using the basic proportionality theorem $\frac{JG }{GF } = \frac{JI }{IL }$.}$$ "}, {"data": ["J", "J"], "text": "$$\text{Using property, if $a = b$, and $a = c$, then $b = c$, therefore, from the above results we can write $\frac{JH }{HK } = \frac{JI }{IL }$}$$"}, {"data": ["H", "K"], "text": "$$\text{Using converse of Thale's Theorem we can say that in the triangle $JKL$, if $\frac{JH }{HK } = \frac{JI }{IL }$ means $HI \parallel KL $ }$$"}]
